item.title: Hyper Light Breaker Early Access ‘Spring Edition’ roadmap announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/hyper-light-breaker-early-access-spring-edition-roadmap-announced

  • PC

First monthly content update due out on February 18.

Publisher Arc Games and developer Heart Machine have announced the “Spring Edition” roadmap for open-world cooperative roguelite game Hyper Light Breaker, which launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on January 14.

The first monthly content update for the Early Access version of Hyper Light Breaker is due out on February 18. During the Early Access period, Heart Machine will push out three types of updates: hotfixes, monthly updates, and major content updates. These updates will include new content and features such as Breakers, Crowns, gear, story content, secrets, and more, as well as gameplay improvements.

Here is the full “Spring Edition” roadmap:

  • February 2025 Monthly Update (February 18)
    • New Player Character
    • New Holobytes
    • New Enemies
    • New Affixes
    • Performance Updates
    • Combat Rebalance
    • Gear Rebalance
    • Bug Fixes
  • March 2025 Monthly Update
    • New Enemies
    • New Assassin
    • New Holobytes
    • New Affixes
    • New Blades
    • Performance Updates
    • Combat Rebalance
    • Gear Rebalance
    • Bug Fixes
  • April 2025 “Buried Below” Update
    • Improved Onboarding
    • New Crown
    • New Player Character
    • New Areas to Explore
    • New Enemies
    • New Assassin
    • Performance Updates
    • Combat Rebalance
    • Gear Rebalance
    • Bug Fixes
  • And Much More to Come
    • New Gameplay Features
    • New Bosses
    • New Areas to Explore
    • New Player Characters
    • More Story Content & True Ending
    • New Enemies & Elites
    • New Assassins
    • New Gear
    • New Blades & Rails
    • New Amps & More
    • New End-Game Difficulty
    • New Progression
    • Version 1.0 Launch

A “Summer Edition” roadmap highlighting updates for May to July will be shared in May.

item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds closed network test for PS5 set for February 21 to 23
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/sonic-racing-crossworlds-closed-network-test-for-ps5-set-for-february-21-to-23

  • PS5

Six tracks, five CrossWorlds, nine characters, and 16 vehicles.

SEGA will host a closed network test for Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds for PlayStation 5 from February 21 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET to February 23 at 4:00 p.m. PT / 7:00 p.m. ET, the company announced. Applications are available now until February 19 via the official website.

The closed network test will feature the following content:

Playable Content

  • Six Tracks
    • E Stadium
    • Rainbow Garden
    • Water Palace
    • Metal Harbor
    • Ocean View
    • Wonder Museum
  • Five CrossWorlds
    • Roulette Road
    • Dinosaur Jungle
    • Kraken Bay
    • Lava Cave
    • Sky Road
  • Nine Characters
  • 16 Vehicles
  • Online Races
  • Some Customization

Playable Characters

  • Sonic
  • Tails
  • Amy
  • Knuckles
  • Shadow
  • Eggman
  • Omega
  • Zazz
  • Cream

Playable Modes

  • World Match
  • Machine Customization
  • Gadget Customization

Users who participate in the closed network test and complete a post-test survey will also receive a special in-game bonus for use in the full game.

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store. A release date has yet to be announced.

If you missed it yesterday, watch the debut trailer here.

item.title: Crowns and Pawns: Kingdom of Deceit coming to PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Xbox One on February 27
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/crowns-and-pawns-kingdom-of-deceit-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-and-xbox-one-on-february-27

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Point-and-click adventure game currently available for Switch and PC.

Publisher Headup and developer Tag of Joy will release point-and-click adventure game Crowns and Pawns: Kingdom of Deceit for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One on February 27, the companies announced.

Crowns and Pawns: Kingdom of Deceit first launched for PC via Steam on May 6, 2022, followed by Switch on September 28, 2023.

Here is an overview of the game, via Headup:

About

Legends of the past come back to life in this charming European mystery adventure.

Crowns and Pawns: Kingdom of Deceit is a modern-day point and click adventure. The game highlights the less explored history of Europe to the world of adventurers. Experience the legendary stories of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, bring to light the villainous branch of the KGB, solve puzzles and follow hints to reveal the secrets of the King who was never crowned.

The story follows a girl from Chicago, Milda, who unexpectedly receives an inheritance from her grandfather—a house in Lithuania. She sets off to Europe, but upon arrival she is threatened by an unknown man, demanding that she gives up her inheritance. Determined and intrigued, she explores the run-down house, discovering old documents and clues dating back to the 15th century. Before long, Milda gets dragged into a dangerous search for a long-lost mysterious relic…

Key Features:

  • A blend of history and myths set in a modern world, featuring real life locations all around Europe.
  • Classic point-and-click puzzles that involve finding items hidden in beautiful environments, creatively combining the contents of your inventory, interesting dialogue choices, and more!
  • Beautiful hand painted art that comes to life with a touch of modern graphics features.
  • A world that reacts to your decisions.
  • Change the looks of the main character to solve puzzles (or for fun!).
  • Fully voiced dialogue.
  • Music written by the award winning composer Daniel Pharos.
